folder: South Street & Beckman Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) Rear view of South Street, east side, at the foot of Beekman Street, as seen from the North Dock on the East River. The view shows several of the buildings of the Fulton Street Fish Market, bordering on the river front. 1923.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, a further view southward.

February 16, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, still further south, and showing the site of the old Fulton Street Ferry.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Fulton fish market - [North dock - Unloading and preparing cracked ice for the city's fish supply.], Manhattan, NY
text:
Fulton Fish Market: Men unloading and preparing cracked ice for the cities fish supply. This activity is on North Dock (Pier 18), an East River pier at the foot of Beekman Street. In the background are buildings on the river side of South Street, that are devoted to the pursuit of this enterprise.

1923
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr
title: Fulton fish market - [North dock - Unloading and preparing cracked ice for the city's fish supply.]

folder: South Street & Beekman Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
104 to 117 South Street, west side, north from Beekman Street, to, but not including Peck Slip. This is part of the area loosely described as Fulton Fish Market, and is reputed to be the largest fish trading center in the world.
January 31, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A portion of the same, showing only Nos. 104 to 108. Also shown (left), is Beekman Street, n°th side, west from South, to Water Streets, crossing Front Street.
January 31, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Beekman Street & South Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Beekman Street, west from the East River, showing at South Street (foreground) the Fulton Fish Market. The 7-story white building in the center is the Beekman Street Hospital (formerly the Hospital of the Volunteers of America) and is No. 115 Beekman Street, at the S.W. corner of Water Street.  Across the roof of same appears the lofty tower of the Woolworth Building.  This is a set of 2 views; No. 1 being an enlargement by the photographer, while No. 2 is a copy of the negative by the New York Public Library.
1936.
Gift of Dr. Michael Nishengrad, A.R.P.S.

folder: South Street & Beckman Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
South Street, east side, north from the foot of Beekman Street, showing the northerly unit of the Fulton Fish Market pier buildings. View 2 shows the replacement. The Brooklyn Bridge dominates the background.

1: August 2, 1937
2: Sept. 3, 1940

P. L. Sperr
